Articles.Content: A PID controller is a system with certain adjustable parameters that is used to move things smoothly and without over-compensating. They are a very widely used technology, and I'm pretty sure KSP2 (which, disclaimer, I haven't played yet) uses them for SAS. Letting people adjust the SAS's PID controller doesn't seem like it'd be terribly difficult, and being able to adjust this PID in the very interactive, hands-on way that KSP allows would teach people about PIDs very well IMO.
